english: old hot pot; traditional hot pot

etymology.description: 老 (old/traditional) + 火锅 (hot pot) = traditional hot pot
etymology.interpretation: 老火锅 refers to a traditional style of hot pot dining, emphasizing authenticity and often associated with long-standing recipes or classic methods of preparation. It is a nostalgic term that evokes the original flavors or atmosphere of hot pot meals.

parts.english: hot pot; a Chinese cooking method

examples.chinese: 我们去吃老火锅(我們去吃老火鍋)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒmen qù chī lǎo huǒ guō.
examples.english: We are going to eat at a traditional hot pot.

examples.chinese: 这家餐馆的老火锅很正宗(這家餐館的老火鍋很正宗)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè jiā cānguǎn de lǎo huǒ guō hěn zhèngzōng.
examples.english: The traditional hot pot at this restaurant is very authentic.

examples.chinese: 四川的老火锅特别有名(四川的老火鍋特別有名)。
examples.pinyin: Sìchuān de lǎo huǒ guō tèbié yǒumíng.
examples.english: Sichuan's traditional hot pot is particularly famous.
